text: Great mussels, beer, and bison burgers. Would definitely go back. Yes, service could be better. But very good food and drinks at a very reasonable price.

Moi et ma blonde avons passé un merveilleux souper ! Même si nous sommes allé souper un lundi, l'ambiance était très cool et le serveur à donné un excellent service ! Nous avons profité du rabais pour les universitaire 1l de bière pour 6,95$ ! Nous avons mangé des moules et elles etaient très bonnes !

This was a good spot for lunch and a drink.  I had the salmon tartare with a side of fries. The fries also came with a choice of sauce, I opted for chipotle mayo.  They also had a variety of drinks, including beer cocktails. I chose a cocktail with a blonde beer and black currant liqueur.  Our server was great and the food was pretty good. A solid spot to stop on Rue St. Denis!

We stopped in on our first night in Montreal, as it was right near our apartment. The server was lovely and accommodating of our large party of 8. We were famished and our selections ran the gamut from burgers to salmon tartare. Beer selection was good and they made a really good old fashioned. All in all, seems like a nice neighborhood place that I'd frequent if I lived here.

Un des rares survivants de la rue St-Denis, la brasserie Saint-Denis (anciennement Bières et Cnie) est réputée pour ses bières et ses moules à volonté. Du dimanche au mercredi, pour 18$, moules à volonté, et vous pouvez changer de sauce d'une fois à l'autre. Les frites sont à 3$ à volonté. Les bières sont excellentes, il y a de très bons cocktails de bière (9$ la pinte). Sinon, il y a des plats typiques de brasserie.. Nous y sommes allés pour oystermania et les huîtres étaient très bonnes. Très bon service! Superbe déco, digne d'un établissement européen ancien. A essayer!

We stopped in for a beverage given the name. We learned that we had to purchase some food in order to drink.  They seem to have quite an extensive selection of Quebec beers, which was nice. The restaurant was out of the first one I ordered, but the server brought a second option back with her, which was appreciated.  We ordered the bruschetta and were not very impressed. The bruschetta was served in a bowl with a few pieces of crispy bread, but there wasn't enough bread for the amount of bruschetta, and the bruschetta was not very flavorful.  Will likely give it another try when we move to Montreal this summer since it is very close to our new place.

La bouffe n'y est pas extraordinaire mais reste tout de même un bon rapport qualité prix! La grande variété de bières et le prix des cocktails en font un lieu agréable pour assister à un marché des canadiens ou bien pour un repas entre amis.
Great place. Cute vibe I like. A lots of beer. Good options.
Uma das mais nhãs cervejarias preferidas em Montreal. Ambiente, cervejas e petiscos muito bons.
The food was ok. Burger had way too much prettier in it but the fries were good. The service was way too slow though considering that it was pretty quiet in there when we went in.

We came here because the mussels were supposed to be good and it got decent reviews but we were mostly disappointed with the food. We got the classic mussel, some fries with chipotle mayo dip and a French onion to split. All around, everything was a bit bland. Mussels could have been more flavorful, French onion soup was serviceable at best, and the fries were a bit flavorless. Beer and service were good. There was hockey on the tv though no one seemed to care or watch as it was not that kind of crowd.
I really like their selection of local beer from different regions of Quebec. If you're into sports, they do have TV's to watch the game.

I've been here once before, but only to drink. This time I went for both food and beer. First off, their beer selection is excellent ! Lots of choices from tons of different countries, but a lot of them are very expensive. Now the food, I tried the mac n cheese which was advertised to contain pogos in it... I thought that meant pieaces cut up and mixed into my pasta, but it was just 1 sad small pogo on top... the mac n cheese was pretty strange tasting too... I also ordered a poutine and that was miles better! A bit too salty but nice gravy and fries. Pretty expensive for average food, would only go to drink some beer.

Excellente place pour manger des moules! À volonté et de différentes saveurs ! Il y a le choix, c'est copieux et la qualité est au rendez-vous. J'ai trouver ma place pour ça! Les prix sont très correct (comptez une soixantaine de dollars pour deux personnes) et le service est très rapide et attentionné. Il y a aussi le choix de bières bien évidement et c'est le combo parfait. J'aime beaucoup la deco année 50! Je vais revenir à coup sûr ! Merci pour l'expérience
I like the specials prices all week, i also like the stylish and warm decoration, gentle service, many tables, tv screen if you wish follow the hockey game..

Première fois a la brasserie Saint-Denis et pas ma dernière   J'ai 2 amies qui cherchais une place pour manger des Moules dans les environs de montréal   Je cherche partout sur Yelp et je tombe sur ça La Brasserie Saint-Denis je Check le menu et bingo j'en trouve pas une pas d'eux mais plus de 15 sorte de saveurs de sauces pour les moules et en plus sont à volonté du dimanche au mercredi juste 26$ avec frites ou salade et un choix de mayonnaise WoW WoW et Re WoW   Arrivée vers 20h un lundi soir y avait du monde mes pas beaucoup la serveuse nous a place à notre place et nous a donner les menu   Moi j'ai pris un coke et mais aimes on pris 1 bière chacun   Nous avons pris un entrée de Nacho à 3 personnes  Et j'en et rapporte en plus   Nous recevons nos plats de moules   Délicieux à part qui manquait un peux de crème dans nos moules tout était parfait   Nous avons pris 3 dessert  Crème brûlée espresso  Pouding chômeur et crème glacé vanille  Crème glacé à vanille seulement     Délicieux les 3 dessert   10/10
